Brett Kline

Senior Team Lead, Legal Online Operations

Hard working and highly skilled professional with 8 years of experience in fraud prevention, risk mitigation, and law enforcement response. Proven ability in leading complex global operations initiatives and people managing a team of investigative analysts. Thrives in a fast-paced working environment that necessitates building strong relationships with a diverse set of stakeholders including Engineering, Product, Legal, and Sales. Passionate about uncovering new fraud trends and building automated solutions to prevent product abuse. Enjoy developing new skills, mentoring team members, and traveling to international offices.

Work Experience


Google LLC

Austin, TX

  • Senior Team Lead, Legal Online Operations
  • May 2018 – Present
  • Manage a team of 27 (25 ICs and 2 people managers) Google employees who handle criminal and civil law enforcement requests for data across all Google products
  • Led team to an all time high in operational performance despite receiving a historically high volume of requests from law enforcement
  • Coordinated and led performance management cycle for a team of 85 full-time employees
  • Conducted 147 interviews during management tenure, including 35 in 2018
  • Founding member of the Cultural Advisory Board, a five person leadership council in an office of 1050. Developed programmatic opportunities to improve learning & development, culture, and diversity. Honored with a Google Citizenship Award for the company wide impact
  • Manager, Trust and Safety
  • September 2016 – May 2018
  • Relocated to Austin, TX after five years in Mountain View (MTV). Selected by executive leadership to build the first Trust and Safety site in the U.S. outside of MTV. Responsible for site leadership activities and management
  • Managed Ad Traffic and Publisher Quality team focusing on protecting Google’s video advertising products. Led team across three international offices to tackle policy non-compliance/fraud on Doubleclick Ad Exchange. Program managed team objectives, handled exec escalations, and mentored analysts.
  • Coordinated enforcement response to Fake News media cycle. Collaborated with cross-functional teams on global rollout of new external policies and rater guidelines. Handled many urgent escalations from PR, Legal, and executives. Enforcement work highlighted in external articles listed below
  • Trust and Safety lead for ads.txt, an industry leading effort to eliminate counterfeit inventory in digital advertising. This standard has been adopted by 200,000+ domains to date
  • Awarded spot bonus by Trust and Safety Vice President for increasing brand safety on YouTube
  • Led an organization wide (800 full-time employees) international travel program designed to foster learning and further develop high performing employees.

Google LLC

Mountain View, CA

  • Team Lead, Trust and Safety at Google
  • February 2015 – October 2015
  • Managed a team of eight analysts whose job is to ensure user safety and minimize legal risk for Google by enforcing Adwords policies at scale
  • Led global enforcement strategy initiatives, including vision/objective setting for policy enforcement across AdWords
  • Collaborated with engineering, product, sales on the rollout of Upgraded URL's, a new Adwords feature which introduces a more structured way of defining ad URLs. This has led to significant crawl load reduction on average across all customers
  • Program managed launch of operational support for DOPPA (Delaware Online Privacy and Protection Act), a law that required Google to adhere to serving restrictions for minors under 18. Coordinated across three global operations offices and multiple cross-functional teams to ensure Google did not get hit with severe fines
  • Strategist/Product Specialist, Trust and Safety
  • June 2013 – January 2015
  • Served as a product specialist for Google’s Landing Page Quality Engineering team, a twenty person group whose mission is to ensure a high quality post ad-click experience for users
  • Developed and oversaw technical objectives and key results between engineering and a global operations team of 80 full time employees and 20 vendors
  • Managed the improvement of machine learning classifiers and enforcement tools to combat challenging and persistent fraud trends in the advertising ecosystem
  • Participated in a confidential cross-functional initiative that gauged the efficacy of our internal abuse detection systems as they relate to deterring high-risk ads. Provided recommendations to Senior Vice President & General Counsel Kent Walker based upon project results
  • Traveled to Singapore, India, and Ireland as part of a three-month program to lead policy enforcement trainings, improve global collaboration, and optimize operational workflows. This program is offered to one analyst per quarter in the global Trust and Safety organization, which consists of over 800 full time employees
  • Worked cross-functionally on multiple Adwords policy launches including Trick to Click, Software Principles, Financial Services, SB 568 Senate Law, and Child Protection
  • Associate, Trust and Safety
  • July 2011 - June 2013
  • Reduced Google’s bad ads rate to an all-time low by reviewing ads, landing pages, and accounts for policy violations, as well building landing page classifiers and writing MySQL scripts
  • Decreased Google’s fraud revenue impact to record low by proactively uncovering large networks of credit card fraud, direct debit abuse, and account hijacking
  • Received Trust and Safety Platinum Award for an operations initiative that fixed 500,000 incorrectly reviewed ads and saved 700,000 ads from requiring a human review
  • Received Trust and Safety Gold Award for identifying and combating large fraud scheme that impacted over ten million dollars of revenue across over 1,000 Adwords accounts
  • Conducted policy investigation of Google’s largest AdSense Direct publishers at the request of senior executives. Such research identified critical contract breaches and led to subsequent corporate litigation

DIRECTV, Inc.

Los Angeles, CA

  • Investigative Analyst, Office of Signal Integrity
  • May 2009 - October 2010
  • Investigated identity theft and financial fraud via field, internet, and database research
  • Prepared evidence for Secret Service and local law enforcement, calculated loss figures, authored investigative reports, resolved customer disputes
  • Presented recommendations directly to the CEO and CFO
